name: KISS-DI
short_description:
KISS-DI provides a series of interfaces for dependency injection functionality, such as finding classes to inject, creating instances of those classes, and injecting them.

DI-1 aims to provide the simplest useful implementation of this functionality, and just supports the most basic kind of DI: field injection. This involves directly setting values on fields, thus bypassing the need for setter methods or constructors. Fields to be injected are identified by the JSR-330 standard @Inject annotation. (A mechanism for specifying test values and implementations is provided, which involves the ability to give a "deployment environment" at initialisation.)

DI-1 also minimises the complexity of configuration, by avoided XML files, and instead relying exclusively on simple properties files.

NOTE - While DI-1 is fully functional, I am still polishing and documenting. ETA for release 1.0.0: spring 2015.
summary: A dependency injection library that tries to "keep it simple"
